tit.e: Taishimichi (the road where Prince Shotoku took)
Taishimichi (the road where Prince Shotoku took)
Taishimichi (the road where Prince Shotoku took)

sen.j: 太子道（たいしみち）とは、日本の古代道路、街道のうち、聖徳太子が通ったとされ、その通称がつけられたものをさす。
sen.e: Taishimichi is Japan's ancient roads that are taken by Prince Shotoku and which have common name.
Taishimichi refer to Japan's ancient roads that are taken by Prince Shotoku and which have common name.
Taishimichi refer to Japan's ancient roads that are taken by Prince Shotoku and which have common name.

sen.j: 主なものとして、次のようなものがある。

sen.j: 法隆寺と飛鳥地方を結んだ「筋違道」。
sen.e: 'The Sujikaimichi Road' which connected Asuka region with Horyu-ji Temple.
'The Sujikaimichi Road' which connected Asuka region with Horyu-ji Temple.
'The Sujikaimichi Road' which connected Asuka region with Horyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 狭義ではこの道を指す。
sen.e: In the narrow sense it means this road.

sen.j: 太秦広隆寺への参詣道として利用されていた道。
sen.e: The road which was used as pilgrimage routes.
The road which was used as pilgrimage routes to Koryu-ji Temple in Uzumasa.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「太秦広隆寺への」を補足しました。
sen.e: The road which was used as pilgrimage routes to Koryu-ji Temple in Uzumasa.
(Refer to old Nijo dori street.)

sen.j: 難波・四天王寺と飛鳥地方を河内飛鳥経由で結んだ「丹比道」（竹内街道参照）
sen.e: 'The Hijita michi road' which connected Naniwa and Shitenno-ji Temple and Asuka region by way of Kawachiasuka (Refer to Takenouchi Kaido Road.)
The Tajihi-michi road' which connected Shitenno-ji Temple in Naniwa and Asuka region through Kawachiasuka (Refer to the article of Takenouchi Kaido Road).
The Tajihi-michi road' which connected Shitenno-ji Temple in Naniwa and Asuka region through Kawachiasuka (Refer to the article of Takenouchi Kaido Road).

sen.j: 難波・四天王寺と法隆寺を結んだ「渋川道」「龍田道」（竜田越奈良街道参照）
sen.e: 'The Shibukawa Road' 'Tatsutamichi' which connected Naniwa and Shitenno-ji Temple and Horyu-ji Temple (Refer to Tatsutagoe-Nara-kaido Road.)
The Shibukawa Road' and 'the Tatsuta-michi Road' which connected Shitenno-ji Temple in Naniwa and Horyu-ji Temple (Refer to the article of Tatsutagoe-Nara-kaido Road).
